intro: Bromus timorensis, commonly known as Timor grass, is a perennial grass species native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear颖果. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It has fibrous roots that help stabilize soil, making it useful for erosion control. Its adaptability to various soil types and climates contributes to its ecological significance in its native range.
